entry.title: SAP Enterprise Support Academy Newsletter November 2025
entry.content:
Dear customers,
Find here an overview of the SAP Enterprise Support Academy monthly newsletter on latest news, training courses, upcoming sessions, and further educational offerings.
The SAP Enterprise Support Academy provides expert guidance and high impact knowledge transfer services that enable you to innovate and be successful with your SAP solutions.

Subscribe to regularly receive latest news and stay informed about the wide range of educational offerings provided by the SAP Enterprise Support Academy that help you to build the digital skills tailored to your needs.

Preview available live sessions on SAP Support Portal, tailored per region:
APJ | EMEA | Latin America | North America*

Join the SAP Enterprise Support Day!

Mark your calendars! SAP Enterprise Support Day 2025 is just around the corner! This virtual event in November is designed to empower you to innovate with confidence and accelerate your business transformation through SAP Enterprise Support – unlocking the full potential of SAP’s support experience.

Register today

SAP Enterprise Support Advisory Council - Q4 update

Benefit from exclusive resources and expert guidance, early access to tools, and practical insights that you can apply directly to your projects. New workstreams focus on a continuous quality check for SAP Signavio, e-learning on SAP Sales Cloud and the release navigator to help upgrade for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition.

Learn more and register

Getting started with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

Jump start your ERP journey by joining the new e-learning on how to get started with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. Dive into the SAP Cloud landscape, master system access, and user onboarding. Explore the SAP Activate Methodology, lifecycle management, and support features.

Get started today

Accelerate AI Adoption with Joule and SAP Business AI

Gain the skills you need to start your AI journey today. How? Join our new Expert-Guided Implementation (EGI) on Unlocking AI: Joule and SAP Business AI from Strategy to Activation, designed to help you accelerate adoption and realize measurable business value from day one. Gain practical guidance on activation, usage, and best practices – ensuring faster time-to-value and higher confidence in execution. 

Register here

Evolving SAP Enterprise Support, from reactive to proactive

SAP Enterprise Support is evolving to meet the demands of today’s fast-paced digital world. Moving beyond reactive help, SAP is empowering users through its Support Accreditation program—designed to build skills, promote self-sufficiency, and leverage AI-driven tools for smarter, faster support. Join thousands of users and partners who are transforming how they engage with SAP support.

Read the interview to learn more

Smarter Support starts here: empower your SAP journey with Support Accreditation

SAP Enterprise Support is evolving to meet the demands of today’s fast-paced digital world. Moving beyond reactive help, SAP is empowering users through its Support Accreditation course—designed to build skills, promote self-sufficiency, and leverage AI-driven tools for smarter, faster support. Whether you’re managing cloud deployments or maximizing existing SAP investments, this learning journey helps you stay ahead and drive business success. Join thousands of users and partners who are transforming how they engage with SAP support.

Read the interview to learn more

How to get started with SAP S/4HANA Finance

Are you about to start with SAP S/4HANA Finance? Then don’t miss our interactive virtual Meet-the-Expert live session that helps you get on board.

Register through this blog post: Get started with SAP S/4HANA Finance

SAP S/4HANA Finance Fundamentals – deep dive

Join us in a multiday training session to discover everything you need to know about delta capabilities in SAP S/4HANA Finance. Mark your calendar for November 11 and register today.

More in this blog post

New EGI dates for conversion to SAP S/4HANA Finance

Join us in a multiday training session to discover everything you need to know about all phases and activities involved in Conversion of Accounting to SAP S/4HANA. The next workshop session will take place November 10-12.

entry.title: Re: Packaging specification determination for pick-HUs in...
entry.content:
Good day @vicentejarque 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at these references, they provide more detailed guidance:

Packaging Specification, Pack Handling Units - Advanced

To summarise, when you use the “Pack Handling Unit – Advanced” option, be aware that the system can only automatically determine packaging specification if conditions like, existence of a packaging specification for the designated material, the relevant profile is active, and the process is triggered from the delivery or warehouse task creation. In this case, the packaging material is proposed from the packaging specification defined through the delivered master data setup.

Your understanding is correct in regard to RF picking. In public cloud, it is currently not possible to determine packaging specifications automatically for Pick-Hus created during RF picking.

I recommend adhering to a clean-core (best practice) approach if you want consistend packaging behaviour for picking and staging, which requires you to use the Handling Unit – Advanced app to pre-pack or predefine HUs at the delivery stage, then RF picking will consume them automatically.

 

Let me know if you have further questions.

 

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: ABAP2XLSX and XLSM
entry.content:
Hello there. 

Is it possible to work with ABAP2XLSX and XLSM (macro-enabled) files?

I’m trying to migrate some legacy developments that currently use OLE2 objects to ABAP2XLSX, but I’m running into issues.

We have a solution where a macro-enabled Excel template (stored on the application server) is downloaded by the program, filled in with case data, and then sent to a supplier to complete.
The template contains several VBA-based validations — for example, a cell must be filled if certain other cells are completed, verifying that an entered EAN code is valid, and so on.

I’m trying to achieve the same behavior using ABAP2XLSX, but I’m getting errors when opening the generated file.

I’ve created a simplified example of what I’m trying to do — Excel file includes a small macro, and with the ABAP code I’m attempting to fill it in and then download it again.
(For the Excel validations to work, you first need to fill in cell B2.)

Do you know if this is possible with ABAP2XLSX?

REPORT ztest.

PARAMETERS:
  pa_banfn TYPE banfn OBLIGATORY.

START-OF-SELECTION.

  DATA:
    lv_rc            TYPE i,
    lv_filename      TYPE char1024,
    lv_filename_down TYPE string,
    lt_filetable     TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF file_table.

  SELECT eban~matnr, maktx
   INTO TABLE @DATA(lt_eban)
   FROM eban
   INNER JOIN makt
    ON eban~matnr EQ makt~matnr
     AND makt~spras EQ @SY-langu
   WHERE banfn EQ @PA_banfn
     AND loekz EQ @Space.
  IF sy-subrc NE 0.
    MESSAGE 'Expedient doesnt exists' TYPE 'S' DISPLAY LIKE 'E'.
    RETURN.
  ENDIF.

  CALL METHOD cl_gui_frontend_services=>file_open_dialog
    EXPORTING
*     window_title            = lv_titulo
      file_filter             = '(*.xlsm)|*.xlsm|'
      initial_directory       = 'U:\'
    CHANGING
      file_table              = lt_filetable
      rc                      = lv_rc
    EXCEPTIONS
      file_open_dialog_failed = 1
      cntl_error              = 2
      error_no_gui            = 3
      not_supported_by_gui    = 4
      OTHERS                  = 5.
  IF sy-subrc <> 0.
    RETURN.
  ENDIF.

  READ TABLE lt_filetable
  INTO lv_filename
  INDEX 1.
  IF sy-subrc NE 0.
    RETURN.
  ENDIF.

  CALL FUNCTION 'SO_SPLIT_FILE_AND_PATH'
    EXPORTING
      full_name = lv_filename
    IMPORTING
*     STRIPPED_NAME       =
      file_path = lv_filename_down
    EXCEPTIONS
      x_error   = 1
      OTHERS    = 2.
  IF sy-subrc <> 0.
    RETURN.
  ENDIF.
  CONCATENATE lv_filename_down sy-datum sy-uzeit '.xlsm' INTO lv_filename_down.

  DATA(lo_reader)    = CAST zif_excel_reader( NEW zcl_excel_reader_2007( ) ).
  DATA(lo_excel)     = lo_reader->load_file( lv_filename ).
  DATA(lo_worksheet) = lo_excel->get_worksheet_by_index( 1 ).

  TRY.
      CALL METHOD lo_worksheet->set_table
        EXPORTING
          ip_table           = lt_eban
*         ip_hdr_style       =
*         ip_body_style      =
          ip_table_title     = space
          ip_top_left_column = 'A'
          ip_top_left_row    = 5
*         ip_transpose       =
          ip_no_header       = abap_true.
    CATCH zcx_excel .
      RETURN.
  ENDTRY.

  lo_worksheet->set_cell( ip_row    = 1
                          ip_column = 'B'
                          ip_value  =  pa_banfn ).

*--------------------------------------------------------------------*
* Save file
*--------------------------------------------------------------------*

  DATA:
    lv_xdata     TYPE xstring,
    lt_rawdata   TYPE solix_tab,
    lv_bytecount TYPE i,
    cl_writer    TYPE REF TO zif_excel_writer.

  CREATE OBJECT cl_writer TYPE zcl_excel_writer_2007.
  lv_xdata = cl_writer->write_file( lo_excel ).
  lt_rawdata = cl_bcs_convert=>xstring_to_solix( iv_xstring  = lv_xdata ).
  lv_bytecount = xstrlen( lv_xdata ).

  CALL METHOD cl_gui_frontend_services=>gui_download
    EXPORTING
      bin_filesize            = lv_bytecount
      filename                = lv_filename_down
      filetype                = 'BIN'
    CHANGING
      data_tab                = lt_rawdata
    EXCEPTIONS
      file_write_error        = 1
      no_batch                = 2
      gui_refuse_filetransfer = 3
      invalid_type            = 4
      no_authority            = 5
      unknown_error           = 6
      header_not_allowed      = 7
      separator_not_allowed   = 8
      filesize_not_allowed    = 9
      header_too_long         = 10
      dp_error_create         = 11
      dp_error_send           = 12
      dp_error_write          = 13
      unknown_dp_error        = 14
      access_denied           = 15
      dp_out_of_memory        = 16
      disk_full               = 17
      dp_timeout              = 18
      file_not_found          = 19
      dataprovider_exception  = 20
      control_flush_error     = 21
      not_supported_by_gui    = 22
      error_no_gui            = 23
      OTHERS                  = 24.
  IF sy-subrc <> 0.
    MESSAGE ID sy-msgid TYPE 'S' NUMBER sy-msgno
               WITH sy-msgv1 sy-msgv2 sy-msgv3 sy-msgv4
               DISPLAY LIKE 'E'.
  ELSE.
    MESSAGE 'Done' TYPE 'S'.
  ENDIF.

 

The excel file has this content:

And a macro with this code:

Private Sub Workbook_BeforeSave(ByVal SaveAsUI As Boolean, Cancel As Boolean)
    Dim ws As Worksheet
    Dim lastRow As Long
    Dim i As Long
    Dim ean As String
    Dim msg As String
    Dim invalid As Boolean
    
    Set ws = ThisWorkbook.Sheets("Prices")
    
    nif = Trim(ws.Range("B2").Value)
    If nif = "" Then Exit Sub
    
    lastRow = ws.Cells(ws.Rows.Count, "A").End(xlUp).Row
    
    invalid = False
    msg = ""
    
    ' Recorre desde la fila 5 en adelante
    For i = 5 To lastRow
        Dim mat As String, price As Variant
        
        mat = Trim(ws.Cells(i, "A").Value)
        price = ws.Cells(i, "C").Value
        ean = Trim(ws.Cells(i, "D").Value)
        
        ' Si hay material, el precio debe estar informado
        If mat <> "" And (price = "" Or Not IsNumeric(price)) Then
            msg = msg & vbCrLf & "Fila " & i & ": Falta precio para el material """ & mat & """"
            invalid = True
        End If
        
        ' Si hay EAN, validar formato y dígito de control
        If ean <> "" Then
            If Not IsValidEAN(ean) Then
                msg = msg & vbCrLf & "Fila " & i & ": Código EAN """ & ean & """ no válido"
                invalid = True
            End If
        End If
    Next i
    
    If invalid Then
        MsgBox "Se encontraron errores:" & vbCrLf & msg, vbExclamation, "Validación de datos"
        Cancel = True ' Evita guardar si hay errores
    Else
        MsgBox "Validación correcta. Guardando archivo...", vbInformation, "Validación de datos"
    End If
End Sub

Private Function IsValidEAN(ean As String) As Boolean
    Dim sum As Long, checkDigit As Integer, i As Integer
    Dim digits() As String
    
    ean = Replace(ean, " ", "")
    If Not ean Like String(Len(ean), "#") Then
        IsValidEAN = False
        Exit Function
    End If
    
    Select Case Len(ean)
        Case 8, 13
            ReDim digits(1 To Len(ean))
            For i = 1 To Len(ean)
                digits(i) = Mid(ean, i, 1)
            Next i
            
            sum = 0
            For i = Len(ean) - 1 To 1 Step -1
                If (Len(ean) - i) Mod 2 = IIf(Len(ean) = 13, 0, 1) Then
                    sum = sum + digits(i) * 3
                Else
                    sum = sum + digits(i)
                End If
            Next i
            checkDigit = (10 - (sum Mod 10)) Mod 10
            IsValidEAN = (checkDigit = digits(Len(ean)))
        Case Else
            IsValidEAN = False
    End Select
End Function

Thanks in advance

entry.title: Re: OData Service Binding | Error 403 Forbidden in BTP AB...
entry.content:
Hello Andrea, 

I had the same issue when trying to use the preview functionality in a Service Binding. There is a workaround that worked for me: Create a Communication Scenario, then add the inbound service to the Communication Scenario and publish it locally. Take a look at this tutorial (Steps 9-11).
Expose a Standard Core Data Service for ABAP Environment 

Best regards,

Patrik Balazs

entry.title: Re: Link between SAP B1 Picklist and its target document...
entry.content:
Hi @anandrd ,

The link lies in the picklist details table (PKL1) and its related document details table, which could be DLN1, INV1, etc.

With Delivery Note as example:

(Object) - PKL1.BaseObject links to DLN1.BaseType
(Entry ID) - PKL1.OrderEntry links to DLN1.BaseEntry and also PKL1.AbsEntry to DLN1.PickIdNo
(Line) - PKL1.OrderLine links to DLN1.BaseLine

I hope it helps.

BR,
Felipe

                "sourcePath": "$['urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:extension:sap:2.0:Group']['type']",
                "optional": true,
                "targetPath": "$['urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:extension:sap:2.0:Group']['type']"
            },
            {
                "sourcePath": "$['urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:extension:sap:2.0:Group']['supportedOperations']",
                "optional": true,
                "targetPath": "$['urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:extension:sap:2.0:Group']['supportedOperations']"
            },
            {
                "sourcePath": "$['urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:extension:sap:2.0:Group']['externalName']",
                "optional": true,
                "targetPath": "$['urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:extension:sap:2.0:Group']['externalName']"
            },
            {
                "condition": "'%ips.application.id%' !== 'null'",
                "constant": "%ips.application.id%",
                "targetPath": "$['urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:extension:sap:2.0:Group']['applicationId']"
            }
        ]
    }
}

The groups in IAS are correctly assigned to the corresponding application  ID (SAC).
However, when provisioning from Local Identity Directory → SAC, only other groups are provisioned successfully — the groups that have the Application ID (SAC) assigned are not provisioned at all.

Why are the groups with the assigned applicationId being skipped?
Do I need an additional condition, property, or filter in IPS to make sure these groups are included in the provisioning?

One more question: when the groups are provisioned from the Corporate Identity Provider, the Application ID in the groups in IAS gets removed. How can this be fixed?

Thanks in advance for your help
Best regards

entry.title: How to manage quota from Time Account Types to "adhoc" Time Types?
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

 

We have configured on our instance the following process:

- We have a Time Profile specific for a country "XPTO"

- On this time profile we have a Time Account Type "X" that receive quota directly form SAP HCM by CPI custom integration, so because this, Time Account Type's  Account Creation Type is "Adhoc"

- On the same Time Profile we had 2 Time Types ("A" and "B") related that consume quota of "X" Time Account Type

The new configuration is:

- I create the new Time Type called "C"

- Linked this new one to Time Account Type on "Time Account Posting Rule"

- Set the Time Type "C" to the Time Profile "XPTO"

- Resend the quota from SAP HCM to SF's Time Account Type

My issue is:

Consider a user that schedule 10 vacation days until now on their current year's quota:

Now, when I open the "Administer Time", the system not consider the past schedules on Time Account and the quota is complete (22 days), but if I create a new request for any of 3 Time Types available, the system consider and up to date the quota for this time account type.

My question:

Is it possible to update this quota automatically when I change Time Account Type?

I assume that it is not possible because the quota is calculated by SAP HCM, and when the quota is sent from SAP HCM he needs to send the last quota calculated. Considering that the Time Account Type is "Adhoc" and don't have an Accrual Rule, I don't have any calculation on Employee Central that can recalc this quota. But maybe I can consider the vacation registers to calculate them.

Let me know what you think about this scenery!

 

Kind Regards.

JC

entry.title: Should you wait until FPS1 is available before implementing or upgrading to SAP S/4HANA 2025?
entry.content:
Hello, and thanks for spending some time reading this blog post! As a member of the SAP S/4HANA RIG (Regional Implementation Group), we share our collective insights and knowledge with the broader SAP community through blog posts and SAP Learning courses. We’ve published over 700 blogs and delivered numerous courses to help you navigate the world of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition.

Today, I want to address a commonly asked question we have received since the release of SAP S/4HANA 2025: Should customers wait until FPS1 is available before implementing or upgrading to SAP S/4HANA 2025?

Let’s clear the air: Customers who want to take advantage of a new S/4HANA release immediately can and should install FPS00. Remember, SAP S/4HANA was first launched in 2015. Therefore, SAP S/4HANA is a mature solution. Additionally, in the latest releases, SAP has emphasized refinement and enhancements over introducing radical changes, which, in the past, could have been the root cause of errors when implementing the initial stack.

Moreover, our commitment to quality is robust. In addition to rigorous testing by our development team, we actively involve customers and partners in the SAP S/4HANA Beta program with every release. This initiative enables the real-world testing of new features and the evaluation of transition paths, such as new implementations and upgrades. Throughout the program, we received no reports that would jeopardize product stability. In fact, survey results from participants supported the release of SAP S/4HANA 2025 based on their testing experiences.

I'd like to share some good news about SAP Fiori – the primary user experience of SAP S/4HANA - and SAPUI5 - the User Interface (UI) framework of SAP Fiori.  

  • In the past, when SAP released a new version of SAP S/4HANA, the initial release (FPS0) was introduced with a SAPUI5 innovation version, which was not intended to be a long-term version. For this reason, customers often preferred to wait for the SAPUI5 long-term maintenance version, released with a later update (FPS01), before going live with SAP S/4HANA in their production environment.

 

  • Starting with SAP S/4HANA 2025, SAPUI5 is released on the long-term maintenance version right from the initial release (FPS0). This means you can confidently use the user experience in production from day one, minimizing disruptions and ensuring easier support. For more information, refer to the following SAP Notes: 2217489 - Maintenance and Update Strategy for SAP Fiori Front-End Server and 3636986 - SAPUI5 maintenance strategy for SAP_UI and the accompanying SAP blog post SAP Fiori deployment options and SAP Fiori front-end server strategy - UPDATE 2025. 

 

  • As usual, it’s recommended that you start with the latest available patch level of your SAPUI5 version. For SAP S/4HANA 2025, the SAPUI5 version is SAPUI5 1.136.  Your technical team can refer to our new learning video Patching SAP Fiori (SAPUI5) to learn how to apply patches quickly and easily.  You can find the latest available patch level at the SAPUI5 Versions Maintenance Status page.

Of course, there are valid reasons why some customers may want to wait for a future FPS. Here are two scenarios that might justify pausing.

  1. Add-Ons Compatibility: If you rely on Partner add-ons (Solution extensions) or third-party add-ons that are not currently compatible with SAP S/4HANA 2025, it’s crucial to engage with the add-on vendors to understand when they will be compatible. It may take a few months, so it could be wise to wait for FPS1 before proceeding

 

  1. Future Innovations: Each FPS comes packed with new innovations. If there’s a specific feature planned for FPS1 that can add significant value to your business, it might make sense to wait until that functionality is available. To find planned features, you can check the Road Map Explorer.

In conclusion, while there might be reasons to consider waiting, the overall landscape for SAP S/4HANA 2025 is looking promising. If you decide to forge ahead, you can do so with confidence in the maturity and robustness of the solution.

If you are considering moving to SAP S/4HANA 2025 and would like SAP support with product-related issues and product-related questions, you can apply to our SAP S/4HANA Customer Care program, following the instructions described here: Cloud Private Edition - Customer Care.

Thank you for reading, and I encourage everyone to embrace the latest innovations that come with SAP S/4HANA!. If you find this blog useful, please consider giving it a "like" or sharing it. I’d love to hear your thoughts and feedback, so feel free to leave a comment. If you have any questions, just drop them in the Q&A section with the tags SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition. We'll try to get back to you as soon as we can.


Thanks,

Brought to you by the SAP S/4HANA RIG team.

entry.title: Re: IAS Tenant
entry.content:
Hi 

Both scenarios are supported as described below:

https://help.sap.com/docs/btp/btp-admin-guide/onboard-to-sap-cloud-identity-services

As mentioned by @Wallace some services already have teh scenario with Test->Test and PRD->PRD. Another example is SuccessFactors. The standard sceanario is to have https://help.sap.com/docs/successfactors-platform/setting-up-sap-successfactors-with-identity-authentication-and-identity-provisioning-services/initiating-upgrade-to-sap-cloud-identity-services-identity-authentication-service

"...we recommend you retain the default settings, which limit the use of Identity Authentication to the appropriate region and corresponding tenant type of the SAP SuccessFactors tenant (for example, ensuring that production Identity Authentication tenants are used for production SAP SuccessFactors tenants, and test/preview Identity Authentication tenants are used for test/preview SAP SuccessFactors tenants)..."

If you are planning for a large landscape and you need to separate user base between prod and non-prod (including posibilities to create test users for non-prod) probably the best option is to use separate tenants.

If you want simpler administration and want to handle prod and non-prod with the same user base makes sense to use one tenant only. This probably aligns with your IDP scenario if you have Entra or simmilar where you most likely have one Productive tenant of Entra and use it for Prod and non-prod apps.

entry.title: SAP CPI SOAP adapter fails on ~10 MB messages. org.apache.camel.InvalidPayloadException:
entry.content:
Hello Community,


I’m working on an integration scenario where SAP ATTP sends EPCIS messages to SAP Cloud Integration (CPI) using a SOAP Sender adapter (Message Protocol: SAP RM).
The same setup works fine for smaller payloads, but larger ones fail immediately inside the SOAP adapter before any iFlow step executes.

Error Details
org.apache.camel.InvalidPayloadException: No body available of type: java.lang.String but has value: org.apache.camel.component.cxf.converter.CachedCxfPayload@24ccd933 of type: org.apache.camel.component.cxf.converter.CachedCxfPayload on: Message. Caused by: Error during type conversion from type: org.apache.camel.component.cxf.converter.CachedCxfPayload to the required type: java.lang.String with value org.apache.camel.component.cxf.converter.CachedCxfPayload@24ccd933 due to java.lang.IllegalStateException: Current event not START_ELEMENT or END_ELEMENT. 
 
So, CPI rejects payloads around 10 MB, even though documentation mentions the SOAP adapter limit ≈ 40 MB.

Analysis so far:
  • CPI’s SOAP adapter is non-streaming — it loads the whole SOAP envelope into memory before any iFlow step runs.
  • Under certain memory pressure, parsing fails early with this generic CXF exception.
  • Transport-level optimizations like Binary XML and HTTP compression from the sender SAP system are not supported by CPI (it expects plain text XML).
  • MTOM Transport level optimisation works but doesn't help with large message

Environment:

  • SAP Cloud Platform Integration - https://ist-test.integrationsuite.cfapps.eu10-003.hana.ondemand.com/
  • Sender SOAP Adaptor (SAP RM) - Version 1.4
  • Runtime Profile: Cloud Integration

Questions to Community:

  • Has anyone observed similar behavior where CPI SOAP adapter fails on ~10 MB payloads despite the 40 MB documented limit?
  • Is there any configuration, plan sizing, or workaround that allows handling larger SOAP XML payloads (10–20 MB) without switching protocol?
  • Any official clarification from SAP on the effective SOAP adapter size limit would also be very helpful.

 SAP Integration Suite

entry.title: Re: How to switch off message no AA577 enter trading partner
entry.content:
You're encountering the “Enter trading partner” warning because the document type used (A*) has the “Inter-company postings” or “Enter trading partner” indicator enabled. This requires the system to validate that a trading partner is entered in the master data (typically in the company code segment of the asset or vendor/customer master).

What you can do is go to AS02 > Company Code view. Ensure the Trading Partner field is filled under the control data section. Alternatively, if intercompany logic is not needed, you can remove the “Enter trading partner” indicator from the document type in configuration via OBA7.

entry.title: Cost Element Category Change in S/4 Hana
entry.content:
Hi All

Is there a way to change cost element category in S/4 Hana? I see that the system allows the change of cost element category currently in S/4 Hana 2020 however SAP suggests following-

a) Either make the change at your own risk. I am not sure why they allow this change if there is any risk. So we won't use this option.

b) Change validity period of cost element. For Example-Change validity end date of cost element to 10/31/2025 & create same cost element from 11/01/2025 to 12/31/9999. However this option is not valid in S/4 Hana so not for us.

c) Delete/reverse transactional data of cost element which won't do as we have lot of data. So this option also not for us.

d) Change cost element category before any new posting in new FY but after closing the existing FY which is practically impossible.

Any other option or work around from anyone? Basically we want to change from cost element category 11 to 01 as G/L with cost element category 11 doesn't work in allocation cycle (Tcode-KSV5). 

Regards

Pankaj

Dear experts, 

As of 1st of January 2026 Bulgaria will have a new national currency - Euro. We have a Bulgarian company in Business Bydesign and currently are testing the currency transition. It is done via transitioning to a new company code. 

We encountered an issue with expense reports. The employee for whome the expense report is being created was hired in Personnel Administration for Bulgaria with old currency(BGN), so the reimbursement and settlement amount is automatically  exchanged to BGN in spite of his/her working company (where we have set up EUR currency). Question is will these system settings of currency for Bulgaria be updated by SAP automatically after 01.01.2026? Or else can we do something about it?

entry.title: Good receipt and label printing for mixed purchase orders
entry.content:
Dear community,

we often have the issue of purchase orders with mixed item positions: Regular production material mixed with free text orders from purchase requisitions of end users in one purchase order.

 In this case there is no label printing possible for regular production material during goods reciept, only a document for Goods Receipt for PO is printed.

The workaround is to post incoming goods in 2 steps, 1st all freetext order items and 2nd all regular production material. But this means one must look into the entire item list of the purchase order to identify the freetext items, this is somehow cumbersome and laborious.

Is there a smarter way to achieve the printing of goods receipt labels for mixed purchase orders?

Thank you.

BR

Dirk

entry.title: 存算分离：重新定义云时代的数据处理架构
entry.content:
如果您对BTP感兴趣，BTP个人精选内容目录 | SAP Blogs 可能有更多你需要的内容

 

 

想象一下，如果你的家里厨房（计算）和冰箱（存储）必须绑定在一起，每次想要更大的冰箱就必须重新装修整个厨房，或者想要升级厨房设备就必须换掉所有食材——这听起来是不是很荒谬？但这正是传统数据库架构在分析场景面临的现实困境。

Snowflake、Databricks等新兴数据平台的快速崛起，正是因为它们打破了这种"绑定"的桎梏。Snowflake从2020年上市至今，目前市值已经超过900亿美元，而它的核心竞争力正来自于一个看似简单却革命性的理念——存算分离。

 

存算分离技术是什么？

存算分离是一种将数据存储层和计算层完全解耦的现代数据架构设计。

简单来说，它就像是把传统数据库的"大脑"（计算引擎）和"仓库"（存储系统）彻底分开，让它们可以独立扩展、独立优化。

这种架构解决的核心问题是灵活性和成本，为企业带来了按需扩展、成本优化和性能提升的三重价值。

 

存算分离解决什么场景需求？

从ROI角度来看，存算分离在多个维度都显著优于传统架构：

成本投入对比：

  • 硬件成本：传统架构需要预置峰值容量的计算和存储资源，而存算分离可以按需付费；存算分离允许采用成本较低的存储（如对象存储与传统数据库相比）
  • 软件成本：减少了数据库软件需求，降低许可证成本
  • 人工成本：高度自动化的云服务可以大幅减少运维人员的工作量

功能和性能价值：

  • 弹性扩展：计算资源可以在秒级别扩展，而传统架构扩容通常需要数小时甚至数天
  • 并发处理：多个计算集群可以同时访问同一份数据，一方面，企业可以用一份数据副本，同时支撑BI报表、即席查询、数据科学等多种业务场景，另一方面还针对单一场景支持更高并发的查询，
  • 成本控制：闲置时可以完全关闭计算资源，只保留存储成本
  • 增强架构韧性：由于计算和存储可以独立运维与升级，所以某个计算节点发生故障时，调度系统可以快速在其它节点重启任务，而无需关心数据在何处，因为存储层是共享且高可用的。这大大提升了整个数据平台的稳定性和容错能力。

典型应用场景：

  • 数据分析团队需要在特定时间进行大规模数据处理
  • 电商企业在促销期间需要临时扩展数据处理能力
  • 多部门需要同时访问和分析同一份数据资产

为什么会有人想到尝试存算分离？

1. 成本压力的倒逼：

企业发现自己为了应对偶尔的数据处理高峰，需要常年维护昂贵的大型机或集群，就像为了偶尔的聚餐，你必须常年租一个大厨房一样不经济，特别是对于初创公司和中小企业，动辄几十万美元的Oracle或IBM DB2许可费用是巨大负担。但当AWS等云服务商证明了"按需付费"的可行性后，企业开始质疑："为什么数据库不能也按需付费？"

2. 业务场景的变化驱动：

现代企业新需求的波峰波谷明显：电商双11、年末财务分析、临时数据科学项目等，都是短时间大量计算需求
3. 云原生时代的技术自信：

基础设施能力的提升给了用户信心，当网络带宽从1Gbps提升到25Gbps+时，工程师们开始相信"网络就是计算机"，而容器技术的成熟让他们相信可以做到"秒级启动计算集群"，最后，对象存储的可靠性让他们敢于把数据完全托管给云存储

4.竞争压力的推动：

新老玩家的博弈，传统数据库厂商（Oracle、IBM）的技术债务太重，很难彻底重构，这给了新玩家（Snowflake、Databricks）一个"弯道超车"的机会，就像特斯拉不需要考虑燃油车的历史包袱，可以直接设计电动车一样

5. 成功案例的示范效应：

互联网巨头的实践，Google的BigQuery、Amazon的Redshift等产品证明了存算分离的可行，这些成功案例让更多企业相信这不是"实验室技术"，而是可以商用的成熟方案


本质动机：效率革命
归根结底，存算分离的根本动机是追求资源配置效率的最大化。就像工业革命通过专业化分工提高了生产效率一样，存算分离通过技术分工实现了计算资源和存储资源的最优配置。

这不仅仅是技术创新，更是商业模式创新——它让数据处理从"重资产"变成了"轻资产"，从"固定成本"变成了"可变成本"，这种根本性的改变正是推动存算分离快速普及的核心动力。

 

 

过去的技术局限与存算分离的突破

传统技术的困境： 过去的数据库采用"存算一体"架构，如Oracle RAC、传统MPP数据库等。这种架构将计算节点和存储紧密耦合，导致了三个核心痛点：

  • 扩展困难：增加存储必须同时增加计算，增加计算也要考虑存储容量
  • 资源浪费：计算高峰期过后，昂贵的计算资源闲置但仍需付费
  • 维护复杂：数据分布、备份、故障恢复都需要考虑存储和计算的协调

 

为什么过去没有存算分离？

技术条件不成熟是主要原因：

  • 网络带宽不足（过去网络延迟高、带宽小，远程存储访问性能差）
  • 云计算基础设施不完善、缺乏高性能，低成本的分布式存储系统

存算分离的核心价值主张： 让企业像用水用电一样使用数据处理能力——用多少付多少，随时开随时关。

 

存算分离技术原理详解

存算分离的核心原理基于三个技术突破：

1. 高性能网络存储层

利用云存储服务（如AWS S3、Azure Blob）作为统一的数据湖，通过高速网络连接保证数据访问性能。现代云网络带宽可达25Gbps以上，保证及时的为计算引擎提供所需要使用的数据。

2. 无状态计算引擎

计算节点除了缓存不保存任何持久数据，只负责处理逻辑。这使得计算节点可以快速启动、关闭和扩展。就像无服务器函数一样，用的时候启动，不用的时候关闭。

3. 智能缓存与元数据管理

缓存层：在计算节点本地缓存热点数据，减少网络需求

元数据服务：独立的元数据服务管理数据位置、表结构等信息，确保计算引擎能快速定位数据

4. 弹性调度系统

基于云原生的容器化技术，可以在几秒钟内启动新的计算节点，并根据查询复杂度自动分配合适的资源规格。

 

为什么现在能做到？

  • 云计算成熟：AWS、Azure等提供了稳定高性能的基础设施
  • 网络技术进步：高带宽低延迟网络使得远程存储访问成为可能
  • 容器化技术：Docker、Kubernetes等技术让计算资源可以快速启动和销毁
  • 分布式存储发展：对象存储技术的成熟为海量数据提供了可靠的存储基础

这种架构让Snowflake、Databricks等平台能够为用户提供"即开即用"的数据处理体验，真正实现了云时代的数据民主化。

 

关于本文内容有任何问题或见解，欢迎在评论区留下你的想法
